header: This is a 22-second music video edit focused on high-energy synchronization. The goal was a relentless, tightly-synced visual sequence, but the library's lack of variety created significant friction.

advisor.hero: The edit is technically sound but emotionally hollow because your library is starving for high-energy payoffs and medium-tempo transitions.
advisor.body: We hit a wall with 'scarcity_medium_energy' and 'missing_payoff_shots'. I had to lean on filler and structural anchors to keep the rhythm alive, which sacrificed the narrative weight of the action beats.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted to establish the brand immediately.
decision_stream.decision: Used clip_004.mp4 because no better alternative was available in the library.
decision_stream.what_if: This slot had no viable upgrade.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted an atmospheric setup to build tension before the music kicks in.
decision_stream.decision: Deployed as a structural anchor clip_001.mp4 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. This was a hard pivot to keep the timeline moving.
decision_stream.what_if: I would have replaced this with an action shot if the library had one.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed a sequence of action, speed, and danger to match the rising track intensity.
decision_stream.decision: Locked in clips 005, 006, 003, and 007 because no better alternative was available in the library. These clips were selected to maintain the beat, preserving the edit's momentum.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted a clear reaction shot to ground the viewer in the moment.
decision_stream.decision: Forced into the slot clip_008.mp4 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. I chose the beat over the story here, preventing a pacing collapse despite the semantic mismatch.
decision_stream.what_if: I would have replaced this with an action shot if the library had one.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed a bridge of speed, spectacle, and victory to carry the middle section.
decision_stream.decision: Selected clips 009, 010, 011, 012, 014, and 015 because no better alternative was available in the library. These were deployed to keep the clock running without losing the sync, preserving the edit's momentum.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I wanted to focus on the survival aspect of the sequence to heighten the stakes.
decision_stream.decision: Used out of necessity clips 017, 018, and 019 to prioritize rhythmic continuity over semantic fit. This was the only way to bridge the gap to the finale, preventing a pacing collapse despite the semantic mismatch.
decision_stream.what_if: I would have replaced these with action shots if the library had one.

decision_stream.what_i_tried: I needed to close out the edit with intensity and a final release.
decision_stream.decision: Used clips 020, 021, 002, and 013 because no better alternative was available in the library. These clips filled the remaining slots to ensure the edit finished on time, preserving the edit's momentum.

friction_log: Started strong with branding, but immediately realized the atmospheric footage didn't have the 'action' punch required for the music.
The middle of the edit became a struggle to maintain energy as I realized the library was missing critical payoff shots.
Ended by prioritizing the 'relentless' pacing over the actual content of the clips just to keep the sync tight.

post_mortem.worked: The technical sync is perfect and the teal-orange grade gives it a professional, cohesive look.
post_mortem.didnt: The edit feels repetitive because I was forced to use filler clips where high-energy action should have been.

next_steps: Capture high-energy action motifs to replace the structural anchors in segments 2, 7, and 14.
Source medium-energy 'payoff' shots to reduce the reliance on filler clips.
Review the 'action' motif requirements to ensure future footage has the necessary movement for music video pacing.
technical: Applied a teal-orange filmic LUT to unify disparate clips.
Enforced a relentless pacing strategy to mask the lack of high-energy motifs.
Maintained nominal sync fidelity across all 20 segments.
